description: Lengths of successive gaps between squarefree numbers.
links: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
M. Filaseta and O. Trifonov, On Gaps between Squarefree Numbers. In Analytic Number Theory, Vol 85, 1990, Birkhauser, Basel, pp. 235-253.
E. Fogels, On the average values of arithmetic functions, Proc. Cambridge Philos. Soc. 1941, 37: 358-372.
L. Marmet, First occurrences of squarefree gaps...
L. Marmet, First occurrences of square-free gaps and an algorithm for their computation, arXiv preprint arXiv:1210.3829 [math.NT], 2012. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 01 2013
K. F. Roth, On the gaps between squarefree numbers, J. London Math. Soc. 1951 (2) 26:263-268.
example: The first gap is at 4 and has length 1; the next starts at 8 and has length 2 (since neither 8 nor 9 are squarefree).
mathematica: ReplaceAll[Differences[Select[Range@384, SquareFreeQ]] - 1, 0 -> Nothing] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 22 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 07 2000
extensions: Offset set to 1 by _Peter Kagey_, Sep 29 2015
